meanings.sent1: I relisted my old bike on the online marketplace.
meanings.sent2: After the event was canceled, they relisted it for next month.
meanings.sent3: She relisted the items after realizing she had forgotten to include the prices.
meanings.sent4: The realtor relisted the property with better photos and descriptions.
meanings.sent5: He relisted the car with a lower starting bid to attract more buyers.

meanings.definition: To place on a list again
meanings.sent1: The librarian relisted the returned books on the shelves.
meanings.sent2: They relisted the names of the volunteers for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The teacher relisted the homework assignments after they got mixed up.
meanings.sent4: She relisted the ingredients in the correct order for the recipe.
meanings.sent5: He relisted the tasks in priority order to stay organized.

meanings.sent1: The seller relisted the antique vase on the auction site.
meanings.sent2: After no bids, they relisted the painting with a lower starting price.
meanings.sent3: He relisted the house with better staging and photos this time.
meanings.sent4: She relisted the handmade jewelry after the first listing expired.
meanings.sent5: The store relisted the clearance items for another round of sales.
